question.questionText: Look at the illustration of the pulley system at the right to answer the questions. What additional disadvantages might there be to this system compared to a single fixed pulley system?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: You have to pull up in this system. In the single fixed pulley system, you get a directional advantage.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: A single fixed single movable has 2 more ropes than a single fixed. A single fixed system has one rope that separates the effort.
A single fixed does not change anything but a single fixed or single movable effort is 3 times the distance.
Another disadvantage would be that the system would be more time consuming.

The disadvantage would again be distance. On the single fixed, if you wanted to lift something 4 foot, you would have to lift it 4 foot. On a single fixed or single movable upward effort, you would have to lift it 12 foot.
